description: Comprehensive mechanics for tracking companion relationships, loyalty, and unique benefits based on trust levels.

loyalty_score.description: Numerical representation of companion's trust and dedication to the party
loyalty_score.modification: Increases and decreases based on party actions and decisions

0-19.description: Companion is ready to leave or has already departed

20-39.description: Companion questions their place with the party

40-59.description: Companion works with party but maintains distance

60-79.description: Companion trusts party and fights alongside them reliably

80-100.description: Deep bond, companion would sacrifice for party

universal_negative.action: Leave companion to die/abandon in danger

loyalty_modification_triggers.companion_specific: Each companion has unique loyalty triggers based on their personality, faction, and values. See individual companion files.

battle_stunts_system.description: Loyal companions provide tactical advantages in combat based on trust level
battle_stunts_system.mechanics: Companions at 60+ loyalty unlock special battle stunts usable once per scene

examples.name: Coordinated Strike
examples.effect: Once per scene, companion and PC can combine attacks against single target. Both roll, take higher result +2.

examples.name: Covering Fire
examples.effect: Companion provides suppressing fire/defense. Allies in same zone gain +1 to defend for one exchange.

examples.name: Tactical Positioning
examples.effect: Companion creates advantageous situation aspect with one free invoke through battlefield awareness.

stunt_categories.name: Unbreakable Bond (80+ Loyalty)
stunt_categories.description: Powerful combat bonuses reflecting deep trust

examples.name: Die For You
examples.effect: Once per session, companion can take a consequence meant for PC, reducing it by one level (Severe becomes Moderate, etc.)

examples.name: Perfect Synchronization
examples.effect: Once per scene, PC and companion move and act as one. Both can take full actions on PC's turn for one exchange.

examples.name: Inspiring Presence
examples.effect: Companion's dedication inspires party. All allies gain +1 to all rolls for one exchange.

examples.name: Last Stand
examples.effect: When PC would be taken out, companion can spend all stress boxes to keep PC at 1 stress. Companion is then taken out but stable.

battle_stunts_system.activation: Player declares use of battle stunt at appropriate moment. GM adjudicates if situation fits. No additional cost beyond once-per-scene/session limits.

gear_bonuses_system.description: Loyal companions who trust the PC provide equipment benefits

types.name: Shared Equipment
types.benefit: Companion shares their signature equipment with PC during critical moments
examples: Aela loans her unique Hunting Bow (Weapon:3, +1 to Shoot at long range) for important hunt
Hadvar provides access to Imperial armory, granting +1 Armor rating for major battle
Ralof shares Stormcloak supply caches, providing healing potions and rations
types.mechanical_effect: Temporary equipment access, typically for one significant encounter or quest

types.name: Crafting Assistance
types.benefit: Companion helps craft better equipment or provides materials
examples: Lydia assists in armor maintenance, granting +1 to Crafts check for repairs
Farkas shares Companions' smithing secrets, reducing time/cost for weapon crafting
Teldryn Sero knows traders, providing 10% discount on equipment purchases
types.mechanical_effect: Bonuses to Crafts checks, reduced costs, or access to rare materials

types.name: Enchanting Support
types.benefit: Companion facilitates enchanting or provides enchanted gifts
examples: Serana uses vampire knowledge to enhance necromancy-related enchantments (+2 to Lore for such enchanting)
J'zargo (if available) offers College connections for enchanting supplies
Loyal companion gifts personally enchanted item (minor +1 bonus to relevant skill)
types.mechanical_effect: Access to enchanting resources, bonuses to enchanting checks, or unique enchanted items

types.name: Signature Gift
types.benefit: Companion presents PC with unique, personal equipment gift
examples: Aela gifts wolf pelt cloak (Armor:1, +1 to Survival in wilderness)
Hadvar presents PC with family heirloom sword from uncle Alvor (Weapon:2, aspect 'Riverwood's Protection')
Ralof commissions Stormcloak-blessed amulet (+1 to resist fear, creates aspect 'Talos Watches')
types.mechanical_effect: Permanent unique equipment with both mechanical bonus and aspect that can be invoked

gear_bonuses_system.gm_guidance: Gear bonuses should feel personal and story-driven, not just mechanical upgrades. Tie gifts to companion's background and player's actions.

companion_specific_benefits.description: Each companion provides unique advantages based on their skills, faction, and personality

loyalty_60_benefit.name: Imperial Connections
loyalty_60_benefit.effect: Provides introductions to Imperial officers, +2 to Rapport with Imperial NPCs

loyalty_80_benefit.name: Legion Intelligence
loyalty_80_benefit.effect: Shares Imperial troop movements and strategy, grants situational aspects in civil war encounters

loyalty_60_benefit.name: Stormcloak Network
loyalty_60_benefit.effect: Connects PC to Stormcloak sympathizers, +2 to Contacts in Nord-majority holds

loyalty_80_benefit.name: Ulfric's Ear
loyalty_80_benefit.effect: Can arrange meeting with Ulfric Stormcloak, may provide Thu'um training opportunity

loyalty_60_benefit.name: Hunt Master
loyalty_60_benefit.effect: Teaches hunting techniques, +1 to Survival and tracking rolls

loyalty_80_benefit.name: Gift of the Beast
loyalty_80_benefit.effect: Offers werewolf blood transformation (if PC desires), provides werewolf tactical advice

loyalty_60_benefit.name: Housecarl's Duty
loyalty_60_benefit.effect: Manages PC's home/equipment efficiently, always has relevant supplies ready

loyalty_80_benefit.name: Unbreakable Loyalty
loyalty_80_benefit.effect: Will never leave PC's side, automatically succeeds at 'protect PC' actions at cost of own safety

dialogue_and_relationship_progression.description: As loyalty increases, companions share more personal information and engage in deeper conversations

progression_stages.dialogue_style: Friendly but guarded, some personal details
Open and trusting, shares deeper thoughts
Intimate trust, considers PC as family/shield-sibling

special_conversations.description: Companion initiates conversation sharing something deeply personal, strengthens bond
Companion proposes formal bond (Nord tradition) or equivalent, grants permanent +5 loyalty and special title/aspect

special_conversations.trigger: PC betrays trust (loyalty drops 20+ in single action)
special_conversations.description: Companion confronts PC about betrayal, chance to explain/apologize or relationship may end

faction_interaction_system.description: Companion loyalty affects how their faction treats PC

high_loyalty_benefits.effect: Faction members respect PC's bond with companion
examples: Imperial soldiers treat PC better if Hadvar trusts them
Stormcloaks offer side quests if Ralof vouches for PC
Companions offer membership path if Aela respects PC

high_loyalty_benefits.effect: Companion actively advocates for PC within faction
examples: Hadvar speaks to General Tullius on PC's behalf, granting audience
Ralof convinces Ulfric to trust PC with sensitive missions
Aela nominates PC for Companions Inner Circle consideration

low_loyalty_consequences.effect: Companion stops vouching for PC with faction
examples: Hadvar's Imperial contacts no longer extend courtesy to PC
Ralof's Stormcloak network becomes unavailable
Companions treat PC as outsider again

low_loyalty_consequences.effect: Companion may speak negatively of PC to faction
examples: Hadvar warns Imperial commanders about PC's unreliability
Ralof tells Stormcloaks PC cannot be trusted
Aela blocks PC's Companions membership

companion_departure_and_return.description: What happens when loyalty becomes too low or circumstances force separation

departure_triggers.outcome: Companion leaves party, will not rejoin without significant story event
Companion may leave immediately (Hadvar if join Stormcloaks, Ralof if join Imperials)
Companion leaves angrily, may become enemy in extreme cases

redemption_mechanics.requirement: Complete personal quest for departed companion
redemption_mechanics.effect: Opportunity to reconcile, loyalty reset to 40 if successful

redemption_mechanics.requirement: Major story event (save companion's life, save their faction, etc.)
redemption_mechanics.effect: Companion may forgive and return, loyalty starts at 50
GM may allow gradual reconciliation through RP and actions supporting companion's values

tracking_loyalty: Keep loyalty score in NPC stat sheet or session notes
Update after each session based on PC actions
Note major loyalty changes (Â±10 or more) in session log
Share current loyalty range (not exact number) with players occasionally
showing_loyalty_changes: Describe companion's reactions to reflect loyalty: cold vs. warm, distant vs. friendly
Have companions comment on PC's decisions in ways that show their feelings
Show loyalty through combat: high loyalty = companion protects PC, low loyalty = companion hangs back
Use dialogue changes: address PC differently based on loyalty (by name vs. by title)
balancing_multiple_companions: If party has multiple companions, each tracks loyalty independently
PC actions may affect companions differently (joining Imperials: Hadvar +loyalty, Ralof -loyalty)
Don't overwhelm players with too many loyalty tracks - focus on 1-2 primary companions per arc
Consider 'party companions' vs. 'temporary allies' - not everyone needs full loyalty tracking
story_integration: Use companion loyalty as story fuel: high loyalty = opportunities, low loyalty = complications
Create dramatic moments around loyalty thresholds (reaching 80 = special scene, dropping below 40 = confrontation)
Companion personal quests should tie to loyalty progression
Let companions' loyalty affect major story outcomes (loyal companion's faction support vs. departed companion's faction opposition)

simplified_loyalty.advancement: Move up/down one tier based on major story events

loyalty_aspects.description: Companions gain aspects reflecting relationship status
examples: At 60 loyalty: companion gains 'Trusted Ally of [PC Name]' aspect
At 80 loyalty: companion gains 'Would Die For [PC Name]' aspect
Below 40: companion gains 'Doubts [PC Name]' aspect
loyalty_aspects.benefit: Integrate loyalty into Fate's aspect system, can be invoked/compelled

no_numbers_loyalty.method: GM tracks major events affecting relationship, determines loyalty tier based on overall story
no_numbers_loyalty.drawback: Less clear progression, harder to predict consequences
